data.title: Travel Expense Form --> How to identify which form it is using

qas.question: Hello, In PR05(Travel Expense Manager), there is a simulate button which will generate standard expense form with expense details. I ran into scenario where one user group expenseform is little different from another group employees expense form. i am guessing that user group form is customized. how to identify what is behind scene form which is used. Thanks

answers.text: Hi, Go to transaction pe03. Specify feature TRVFE. Select decision tree and display. In the output based on the field used by you as a basis of form assignment, you can identify the form assigned for your case.

data.title: #CoE#HP01 In which CDS View can the "text" tab of sales order header be found?

qas.question: #CoE#HP01 In which CDS View can the "text" tab of sales order header be found? here

answers.text: In the CDS View I_SALESDOCUMENTITEM, there is a field SALESDOCUMENTITEMTEXT (Short Text for Sales Order Item).

data.title: which FM stores Variant configuration in VA01 to DB

qas.question: Hi We are looking for functional module which will save Variant Configuration data to database in VA01. In VA01 tcode when we create variant configuration data for each line item level , it is stored in database with reference to some object ( VBAK-CUOBJ) . We can retrieve this data for each line item by using this instance number. While debugging VA01 when we tried to save variant configuration data in each item level , first temporary instance is saved in database along with its related characteristic values. Later FM 'CUKO_CONFIGURATION_TO_DB' converted this temporary instance to permanent instance and this unique number got stored in VBAK-CUOBJ field. Can somebody help us to provide logic of FM which stores these config characteristic values to temporary instance in database before assigning it to permanent instance? Thanks, Snehal

answers.text: HI Snehal, Did you check function module CUXI_SET_SINGLE_CONFIGURATION?

data.title: Revoke a Released SES, for which an Invoice is already parked...

qas.question: Hello people, I am developing a workflow for a approving Invoice based on Service Entry Sheets and am running against a problem. I have created a PO for a service for 200 euros. A SES for 200 euros was created for it and fully released, because there is a release strategy on it. An invoice for 300 euros comes in for the SES and we park the invoice. The idea is that via the workflow the SES has to be changed to 300 euros and then the invoice can be posted. However, when trying to revoke the SES, the system says the I am not allowed to revoke the SES, since there is already a parked invoice against it! Is this customizing which we can change, or do we have to come up with a different solution? Thans already for your answers & kind regards, Erik

answers.text: Hi Eric, Since you have already refered the SES for creating the invoice, it is not allowing you to make those changes. Only way is to remove the invoice first and then revoke the SES. regards Anand.C

data.title: Is there a module is SAP which caters Legal related requirements and scenarios

qas.question: Hello Experts, We came across a requirement as: "The company has some agreements with vendors,customers etc.. It has some warranty also given and taken with some expiry dates also. There are few renewal process also . User wants such scenario in SAP along with workflow on expiry,renewal,creation of such legal documents." Kindly suggest me is there a module in SAP which can cater to these requirements. Thanks & regards Saurabh Tiwari

answers.text: Hi Saurabh, SAP has a a Permit Management functionality within SAP Environmental Compliance module. SAP EC can manage Permits and legal requirements whether they are environmental or not, and has great email (workflow) and task functionalities. Legal documents can also be attached to said permits/requirements. Hope it helps! Best regards, Fernando

data.title: How to change overdelivery tolerance on PO,for that material which have not material master record?

qas.question: How to change overdelivery tolerance on delivery tab of po,for that material which have not any material master record,kindly suggest,screenshot is attached for your refererence.......

answers.text: You need to change defined screen layout for Purchase Order. I am giving path below. SPRO Material Management-Purchasing-Purchase Order-Define Screen Layout at Document Level- Select Tcode and goto detail and find the Overdelivery tolerance on GR/IR Control. Here you can change the status from display to Optional. Then this field will be eneabled and you can put Overdelivery tolerance % in Purchase Document.

data.title: Scrap Sales. Which path to take ? SD or FI

qas.question: Hello everyone, Looks like I can sell "SCRAP" materials out of SD as well as FI module. I can create a material for Scrap and then sell it via SD module. Or can create a FI transaction directly from FI module. What is the best method to handle ? Can you tell me pro / cons in either cases ? Thanks, Dipankar Biswas

answers.text: Hi SD path is good. so that you can track the how much sales you have done to customers etc. Pricing agreements etc Good reporting strucutre are in place. Also you can have agreements with the customers and follow the release orders to lift the scrap materials with in stipulated time frame. regards, Ramana

data.title: Which BAPI or FM was corresponding to Tcode QA12 ?

qas.question: Hi, Experts, Which BAPI or FM was same action as QA12 ? Thanks.

answers.text: Go to transaction BAPI/Quality Management/Quality Inspection/Inspection lot/SetUsageDecision

data.title: Which marketing document line links to which journal line

qas.question: Hi All, Is there anyway to know which marketing document line uniquely links to which journal line. Example: Item '0001' - COGS acc = 123001 Item '0002' - COGS acc = 123002 An AR Invoice with both items will create journal entries for the COGS leg to both 123001 and 123002. Is there some way of determining which Invoice line posted which COGS journal except for the account code? Regards,

answers.text: Hi, There is no direct link because the similar line items in marketing document would be added together to one line in JE. It is not one-to-one relationship. Thanks, Gordon

data.title: Selecting which outlook email address to send from SAP

qas.question: SBO Version: 8.81 PL07 Forum, I am wondering if there is a way for us to select which outlook email address we send emails from SAP? I am wondering if there is a way for us to select which outlook email address we send emails from SAP? For example you may have a personnel email address:fred.bloggs@email.com- but you may want to send it from another more generic address:accounts@email.com For example you may have a personnel email address:fred.bloggs@email.com- but you may want to send it from another more generic address:accounts@email.com For example you may have a personnel email address: fred.bloggs@email.com - but you may want to send it from another more generic address: accounts@email.com Does anyone know if this would be possible? Does anyone know if this would be possible? Orla Orla

answers.text: Hi Orla, Hi Orla, 1. In the Windows system tray, double-click (SAP Business One Service Manager). 1. In the Windows system tray, double-click (SAP Business One Service Manager). Alternatively, choose Start → Programs → SAP Business One → Server Tools → Service Manager. Alternatively, choose Start → Programs → SAP Business One → Server Tools → Service Manager. 2. In the SAP Business One Service Manager window, in the Service drop down list, select SBO Mailer and choose the Settings button. 2. In the SAP Business One Service Manager window, in the Service drop down list, select SBO Mailer and choose the Settings button. 3. In the General Settings window, Authentication - Select Authentication give Username and password for the Mail id which you want to send from. 3. In the General Settings window, Authentication - Select Authentication give Username and password for the Mail id which you want to send from. For scheduler Report.Basic For scheduler Report.Basic 1. In the Windows system tray, double-click (SAP Business One Service Manager). 1. In the Windows system tray, double-click (SAP Business One Service Manager). Alternatively, choose Start → Programs → SAP Business One → Server Tools → Service Manager. Alternatively, choose Start → Programs → SAP Business One → Server Tools → Service Manager. 2. In the SAP Business One Service Manager window, in the Service drop down list, select SBO Mailer and choose the Settings button. 2. In the SAP Business One Service Manager window, in the Service drop down list, select SBO Mailer and choose the Settings button. 3. In the General Settings window, define the mail settings according to your company settings. 3. In the General Settings window, define the mail settings according to your company settings. 4. In the Scheduled Report Settings area, specify the file path of the SAP Business One client. 4. In the Scheduled Report Settings area, specify the file path of the SAP Business One client. 5. Optionally, enter an email subject prefix which precedes the subject of each scheduled email with the generated report. 5. Optionally, enter an email subject prefix which precedes the subject of each scheduled email with the generated report. 6. Enter a name as the email sender. 6. Enter a name as the email sender. 7. Enter the sender email address. 7. Enter the sender email address. Hope Helpful, Hope Helpful, Regards Regards Kennedy Kennedy

data.title: Production orders for which the goods issue has not been performed

qas.question: hi, How can i find the list of production orders for which the goods issue has not been made. Regards Badri

answers.text: As others have already said, COOIS is the best way of doing this. But you find the following useful too: If the GI for the production order is carried out through backflushing, you can check the entries in table RESB. For example, you can use the select options to exclude orders where RESB-RGEKZ = "X". This will give you a list where the backflush has not occurred for orders.

I need to find this data in production system. is there any table for this ? I know the text object is EINE and text ID is BT. how can i find such PIRs which have purchase order text ( for a plant ) Thanks Meenakshi

answers.text: Run the report RSTXTC3 with appropriate selection criteria as suggested in this document You will get the info record with line item with plant in the field "Name" which has the Purchase order text.

data.title: Which MRP-Group fields have priority over material-master MRP view fields ?

qas.question: Hello friends, I am always confused as to which MRP-Group fields have priority over material-master MRP view fields. Does anyone has a ready list ? Is there any set rule to remember this list ? Thanks for your help. - Chetan

answers.text: Chetan, No confusion now. I think I am responsible for your confusion. What the OSS notes says is correct and what all the forum members (except my first statement) have reinstated is also correct. Forum members have told that Material Master fields take prcedence over MRP group parameters. This is correct. OSS notes says that MRP group parameters takes precedence over plant parameters. This is also correct. Hope it clears all your confusions. IF so close this thread - after rewarding suitable points to all except me ! I think I should be given negative marking for misleading you. Ram

data.title: In which table can I get the materials associated with a particular sample drawing procedure?

qas.question: I want the list of materials which uses a particular Sample drawing procedure. In which table can I find this?

answers.text: The sampledrawingprocedures are in the inspection plans. drawing You need to identify the groups and group counters that utilize the sample drawing procedures. (Table PLKO). Then use that info and find which materials are assigned to those groups and group counters in MAPL. Sample drawing procedures are not defined in the inspection type setup (QMAT) of the material master. Sampling procedures CAN be defined in the inspection type setup in the material master but its pretty unusual. Craig
No accepted solution found

data.title: Available quantity is zero on MD04 vs MMBE(unristricted) which is 82

qas.question: Hi MM Gurus I have an issue where the first line in MD04(available quantity) is zero, but when i check MMBE for the same material i have quantity of 82. please guide me on what i need to do in order to reflect the quantity of 82 to the first line in MD04. see screenshot

answers.text: Why do you expect to see 82 in MD04 instead of 235? Did you create an extra MRP area for this storage location 2003? MD04 is at plant level if you do not make use of MRP area. Can you please click the button in front of the material number to see if there is a BAdI active which might have changed some figures when creating the numbers for MD04

data.title: Which segment in Orders05 have field 'Created by' PO creator name

qas.question: Which segment in Orders05 have field 'Created by'ErnamPO creator name. Ernam Someone told me * ERNAM is in E1EDK01* , but not able to find it.

answers.text: Hi Mukesh Mahajan ERNAM : Name of Person who Created the Object Above field is avilable in Segment : E1EDL37 in general Po Data at header level avilable in Segment type E1EDK02 IDoc: Document header reference data QUALF 001 : Customer Purchase Order BELNR XXXXXX : IDOC document number DATUM 20090310 : Date If you want to Populate the Person who Created PO at Header Level... Then extend the segment E1EDK02 and write user exit to populate the Name in extended segment. This will solve your issue Thanks Ramesh Edited by: Ramesh on Feb 25, 2010 8:32 PM

This transaction normally authorize to the specific customizing consultant at your company but not everyone. Please kindly get the authorization from your Basis colleague. Hope this information will help. Ian Wong

data.title: Which Results Analysis Method is good for LOSS Projects?

qas.question: Dear Experts, Our client have Loss projects scenario. for Eg. Plan Revenue_: 100, Plan Cost__________: 120 Loss______________: = -20 Loss 20 should post in accounts at first period end closing time itself for that which Results Analysis Method can help me for it. Plz give me your valuable solution soon. Thanks Bhagirath

answers.text: Results analysis calculates a reserve for imminent loss with the following formula: If Planned Cost of Valuation > Planned Revenue of Valuation: Planned Loss = Planned Cost of Valuation u2013 Planned Revenue of Valuation Realized Loss = POC * Planned Loss Reserve for Imminent Loss = Planned Loss u2013 Realized Loss The OSS note602707explains for which RA methods reserves for imminent loss are calculated. I think you can use one of the simple POC methods. 602707 Kind regards, Paulo

data.title: How to know which partner procedure is used

answers.text: You can check in VOPAN. Select the sales Doc header and check the procedure used and also the partner functions in the procedure for sales order. The next is the parner determination procedure assignment where the procedure is assigned to the sales document type. Regards Harish

data.title: Report to check Standard WBS link to which standard network and activity

qas.question: Dear All, Is there any way or standard report to check standard WBS (cj93) link to standard network/activity (CN03). Normally we create project by using template existing, we would like to check the structure. Is there any way to check the standard template for it ( WBS template link to network/activity template). Thank you. Nies

answers.text: Hi, Please try this: 1. Tcode : CN41 2. Change database profile: In that in the origin check mark the Standard structure. Continue.. 3. At the bottom of the selection screen check mark the standard structures. 4. In the selction area for the Project hit F4 and select the project based on the standard WBS Element. 5. Exceute the report. Hope this is useful. Reward points if found useful. thanks..

data.title: which movemen to use

qas.question: I have several sites that have numerours articles that are all NLAG article type which are all in negative stocks. Which is the best movement to use to zero the stocks. regards ady owen

answers.text: in general I would say you have to create inventory with 552 or 202 movement to make negqative stock zero. But this is only possible with the right setup in OMS2. Before you do the movements, you have to make sure that NLAG is stock managed After all you NLAGs are zero again you have to turn off the quantity managment.
